skill.name: FastAPI Development
skill.description: Build async APIs with FastAPI, including endpoints, dependency injection, validation, and testing. Use when creating REST APIs, web backends, or microservices.
skill.summary: Build async APIs with FastAPI including endpoints, dependency injection, Pydantic validation, and TestClient testing.
skill.author: bossjones

security_audit.summary: All 27 static findings are false positives. The analyzer misidentified markdown code fences (```) as Ruby backtick execution, Python syntax as cryptographic algorithms, and input validation logic as system reconnaissance. This is legitimate documentation for FastAPI development.

content.value_statement: FastAPI is a modern Python web framework for building APIs with automatic validation and documentation. This skill provides ready-to-use code patterns for endpoints, dependency injection, and testing so you can create production-ready APIs faster.
actual_capabilities: Create FastAPI endpoints with path, query, and body parameters
Implement dependency injection for database connections and shared logic
Define Pydantic models for automatic request and response validation
Handle errors with HTTPException and custom status codes
Write tests using FastAPI TestClient for endpoint verification
Generate OpenAPI documentation automatically at /docs endpoint
limitations: Does not cover database integration with SQLAlchemy or async ORM setup
Does not include authentication or authorization patterns
Does not address deployment to production servers or containers

use_cases.title: REST API development
use_cases.description: Build CRUD APIs with automatic validation, documentation, and async support for high-concurrency applications.

use_cases.title: Data service endpoints
use_cases.description: Create fast data access endpoints that return validated JSON responses from database queries.

use_cases.title: Microservices architecture
use_cases.description: Build lightweight, independent services that communicate via REST with clear contracts and documentation.

prompt_templates.title: Basic endpoint
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a FastAPI endpoint at /hello that returns a JSON message with a name query parameter

prompt_templates.title: CRUD operations
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a FastAPI API for managing items with Create, Read, Update, and Delete endpoints using Pydantic models

prompt_templates.title: Database integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a database dependency to my FastAPI app using async context manager for connection cleanup

prompt_templates.title: Advanced validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a FastAPI endpoint with path validation using Path(gt=0), query validation using Query(max_length=50), and response models

output_examples.input: Create a FastAPI endpoint for user registration with email and password fields
output: âœ“ Created UserCreate Pydantic model with email validation and password min_length
âœ“ Added POST /users/register endpoint with automatic validation
âœ“ Returns 201 status code on success with created user data
âœ“ Added error handling for duplicate emails with HTTPException 400

best_practices: Use async def for I/O-bound operations to handle concurrent requests efficiently
Define Pydantic models for all request and response data to enable automatic validation
Use response_model parameter to control exactly what data is returned to clients
anti_patterns: Do not use sync blocking calls in async endpoints without moving them to background tasks
Do not return sensitive fields like passwords in response models without explicit opt-out
Do not skip input validation by not defining Pydantic models for complex request bodies

faq.question: How do I run my FastAPI application in development?
faq.answer: Use uvicorn with --reload flag: uvicorn main:app --reload. This auto-restarts on code changes.

faq.question: What is the difference between Path and Query parameters?
faq.answer: Path parameters are part of the URL route like /items/{item_id}. Query parameters come after ? like ?skip=0.

faq.question: How does FastAPI handle validation errors?
faq.answer: FastAPI automatically returns 422 Unprocessable Entity with error details when request data fails validation.

faq.question: Can I use FastAPI without async?
faq.answer: Yes, define endpoints with regular def functions. Use async def for I/O operations like database queries.

faq.question: How do I add custom exception handling?
faq.answer: Create exception handlers with @app.exception_handler(ExceptionType) decorator and register custom response logic.

faq.question: Where is the automatic API documentation?
faq.answer: Access Swagger UI at /docs or ReDoc at /redoc when your FastAPI application is running.
